text: Thanks Carl! Had several treehouse and trillium and this was the best! Just super awesome hazy IPA that burst with tropical fruits, citrus, orange juice, and a pillowy mouthfeel. So good.

Thanks to Clark. Like drinking a peach infused biscuit, the kind us 20th century forty somethings gnawned on as babies.
Appearance is very murky, marmalade shade o orange with whispy clouds of white. Aroma of metallic biscuit, banana, peach, and sawdust. 
Complex in overall composition, not leaning heavily towards any direction, balanced, savory, and deep.

Can into a solo cup showing practically orange juice with no head. 

The nose shows juicy orange, pineapple, and mango. 

The palate is full bodied and lightly carbonated. Flavors of moderately intense pineapple, papaya, dry orange with light pine resin. Moderately strong dry cannabis and pineapple bitterness.

Data puszkowania 11.04.2017. Może nie taka piana jak w Green Tree House, ale poziomem zmętnienia kładzie wszystkie IPA jakie widziałem. Aromatycznie zdecydowanie tropikalnie - ananas, marakuja, mango. Smak tak jak powyżej dodając cytruski, mega wytrawne, tu podbudowa słodowa nie do wykrycia, ale to gęste, ale to się soczyście i powoli przetacza przez gardło! Bomba!
Aroma mais de maracujá e menor manga e pêssego. Corpo aveludado de médio amargor persistente. Mantém muito bem a mistura de frutado maduro com lupulado.

4/21/17. Giant can thanks to Carl! Had right with some Treehouse and this was better! Hilarious NE pour - milky ass protein haze murky AF orange pour with an awesome khaki head. Awesome aroma, tropical fruits, OJ, dank, delicious. Awesome flavor, fresh hops, tropical fruits, OJ, citrus. If you think this is bad for beer, youre a fucking idiot.

Pours extremely hazy yellow. Likr fruitjuice ! Very small layer of foam. Smell is intense ( I kid you not ) smell is bit bitter, not overly intense though. Taste is full, bitter, crisp, bit lemonish.intense, mild IPA yeastyness. Nice, but overhyped to me. Doesnt have that much aroma, which is very contradictive to my expectations.

Tasted from can. Pours a super cloudy orange with thick white head. Appearance of juice. Aroma is ridiculously tropical fruity. Mango, peach, passion fruit, pineapple. Very well balanced. Flavors of mango, pineapple, passion fruit, slight resin, caramel and hints of floral notes. Incredible IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Can shared with Rich cheers mate; cloudy yellow pour with a thin white head, aroma has some dusty pine hop, taste has delicious peach, mango pulp, pineapple, awesome stuff.

Densely turbid waxy yellow color out of the can with a short lived white head. Bright pineapple and orange juice nose. This is another of the really hoppy tropical fruit, candied orange, stone fruit and mandarin orange juice Not as bitter as some of the double dry hop beers. Really nice hop juice.

Can, by way of a trade. Bright but murky (how does that work?), orangey gold. Film of super sticky, lasting, white head. Nose has peach and ripe mango in spades. Some stone fruit. A little pissy and a little resinous. Sweet, vanilla malt backdrop. Mouthwatering. Taste is slightly sweet with some stony bitterness. Mouthfeel is perfect. Soft, juicy, bright and zingy. This is so easy drinking. Light and juicy bitter finish. This just disappeared.

Can from trade. Pours a hazy creamy orange color, foamy white head... Aroma of citrus, orange creamsicle, tropical fruits, mango... Mouthfeel is creamy, lots of tropical fruit hops, tangerines, citrus, mango, juicy creamy finish... Really nice IPA

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 20, 2017 Taster at the source hazy grapefruit with a nice thin white head and nice lacing. Aromas of grapefruit grass pine and floral notes. Taste is well balanced between the citrus and the bitter hops. Very drinkable.

16oz can purchased at Fort Point. Pours golden orange. Thick and completely hazy. Looks like a mango nectar with a fuzzy lasting white head and nice lacing. Smells like straight citrus, orange, mango and sweet pineapple. Sweet galaxy, bitter hops round it out. Tastes very fruity, sweet mango pineapple and citrus. Great hop bitterness and smooth resin dry finish. Standard Trillium, full mouthfeel. Another one out of the park for Trillium.

Super hazed with a nice white head. Bone dry with sharp hop dominance, grapefruit, light bodied. Clean dry hop aroma. 

Notes: On tap at the brewery tasting room, Canton (March 17)
Canned 3/6/17 poured an opaque yellowish orange with an off white head. Not as strong an aroma as other offerings. Strong hop flavor on the back end as expected with a DDH, but not overly bitter.

Draft @ RateBeer Best 2017. Pours a hazy yellow golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty peachy hoppy aroma. Fruity malty peachy hoppy bitter citrus flavor. Has a fruity malty peachy hoppy bitter citrus finish.
[1/29/17] Bottle/Can/Crowler/Growler at the RateBeer award ceremony bottle share at Flamingo Hotel in Santa Rosa. Cloudy yellow. Fruity and oniony hops, juicy. Dry, moderately bitter.

Bottle/can shared at Ryans January 2017 tasting. Pours a deep, hazy golden body with huge white head. Nose is soft citrus, mango and guava. Mouthfeel is medium bodied - really great for a juicy IPA - with notes of citrus, pineapple, juicy tropical notes, pine and light honey-drizzled grapefruit.

Murky golden-orange body, medium sized creamy white head, dense lacing. Murky under-ripe stonefruits, mango, grapefruit rind, and florals. Nice display of Galaxy hops. Medium bodied, mellow carbonation, lively bitterness, juicy, rounded finish.

Can from Nate. Thanks dude! It pours a hazy yellow color with a white head. The aroma has pineapple, grapefruit, citrus and tropical fruit. The flavor has orange, pineapple, grapefruit and a hint of spicy hops. Solid bitterness. Another top notch NE IPA from these guys.

Can, 1 pint. Hazy golden, frothy offwhite head. Dank aromas of fruity hops. Medium bodied, soft carbonation. Medium sweet, medium to heavy bitter. Dry and astringent. Bitter hoppy flavors into a stinging finish.

Can, 1 pint. A cloudy golden beer with minimal head. Hoppy aromas with some tropical fruits. Taste is very bitter with some sweetness. Medium bodied with some carbonation. Juicy, yet with a bitter and astrigent finish.
Can. Color of Tropicana with a medium head. Strong mango and tangerine aroma. Solid bitterness. Fairly juicy tropical fruit flavor. Some graininess. Full bodied.

Tasted on 1/9/17 from a 16oz can, big thanks to Alex for this one. Pours almost milky muted orange with a huge , rocky white head that slowly recedes to thick, billowy lace. The nose is a tremendous blend of orange juice and peel, savory herbs, pineapple, grapefruit, grass, and some other dank green notes. The flavor is a little bit more focused on the savory herbal and lightly green bitter notes, still with plenty orange and grapefruit peel, and less, but still prevalent tropical pineapple. The body is nearly full with average carbonation, and a long lightly bitter grapefruit peel, herbal, and pineapple finish.

Cloudy orange, white cap. Wonderful nose exactly as advertised...mango, resiny, bitter grapefruit and orange peel, some pineapple and very light grass. Crushable as expected, though without having this side by side with a regular Congress, I cant give either the nod. Hopefully a head to head one day.
All those things present in the aroma roll over the tongue in waves. Maybe a touch more bitter and slick feel than base CS. Top 3 IPA for me...maybe the top. Hard to say...

Pours a hazy murky pale orange juice in color. The aroma is pungent galaxy, huge juicy tropical fruit notes of oranges, pineapple, faint grapefruit and a hint of lemon. Whoa, this beer is insanely aromatic. Palate is bone dry and there is a hint of astringency or heat from the alcohol in the finish
UPDATED: AUG 18, 2016 Bottle. Aroma is huge juicy mango, pineapple, and pine. Tastes super juicy tropical fruit, pine and grapefruit. Love this beer so much. Perfect galaxy showcase.
Bottle shared by a friend. Pours clear amber with a thick white head. Aroma of malt, pine and grass. Malty and piney flavor with a bitter grapefruit finish.

750 mL bottle. Hazy/murky orange. Smells of pine wood, mango, and bright orange. The woody flavor is almost like a spicy aroma. Taste is a little less dynamic. Mostly bright orange and tropical fruits. Pale malt sweetness. Orange and dank in the back end. A little sweet. Medium body, Lightly creamy.

Bottle. Milky yellow pour with a white head. Muted tropical fruit hop bouquet. Woody with almost mango, and citrus/pine hop notes. This bottle was 4 weeks old and I suspect it would have been a stunner on tap. Good body and mouthfeel.

Thank you Matthew!

Super hazy, orange juicy appearance. This is what a New England IPA looks like. Boom. BJCP folks can roll their eyes now. Unreal aroma. Glorious. Guava, melon, dank hops, grilled pineapple, grapefruit, lemon rind. Fantastic flavor, following the aroma. Hop juice. Absolutely delicious. One of the best hoppy offerings Ive had from Trillium.

Pour from a bottle, light yellow in color, super hazy, white head and lacing. Massive tropical fruit nose. Delicious taste, low bitterness. Grapefruit abound. I would drink this all the time if I could.

Cloudy ora ge color. A good looking beer. Better than the regular version. More intense hops, some fruit also, mango and pineapple. Good.
.
Pours a cloudy pale orange yellow. White head. Aromas of tangerine, melon, peach. Taste is slightly sweet. Slightly bitter. Super amazing.

Sample at Trillium Canton with koleminer20. Aroma is juicy, tropical fruit, dank, citrus, amazing. Appearance is orange juice, orange, hazy, white head. Taste is juicy tropical fruit, citrus, pine, dank resin. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light crisp carbonation, dank pine aftertaste. Overall, this is fucking good.

On draft at Trillium Canton. The pour is a huge juicy orange juice that everyone loves. Its got a thin white head and a couple spots of lace. The aroma is juicy as fuck. Bright juiciness with a hint of bitter rind and a little hop. Its just so bright and magical. The flavor is like a blend of pineapple and orange juice with a lovely bittering hop tagging along. The hop theirs the balance of juices out a little, but its still very good. The mouth feel is excellent. Light and crisp with a great carbonation and a lingeringly juicy, somewhat bitter hop finish. Great beer.

[ bottle ][ 1.5oz ][ @Tasting ][ $? ][ Schnapps snifter ][ 03.25.16 ]
hazy gold shimmer, frothy white head lasts. Peanut-pine nose, lightly papery bitterness, light cleaning product. Oily resin front palate, off paper-oxidized and orange sweetness. Too full, too much sweetness lasts long.

Growler on 6/8/16. Pours like an orange juice milk shake. Beyond hazy, thick, juicy, pungent. Nose is crazy fruit. Taste is the same. Citrus, grapefruit rind, ruby red grapefruit flesh, orange, gummy bears. Lots. Good

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared by Joey. Poured a super hazy bright milky yellow with a foamy bright white head. Aroma/flavor of old citrus meat, lime, peach skin, pineapple rind, passion fruit and toast. Bigger body with strong carbonation and a slight hint of heat but this beer was drank rather warm. Good stuff.

750ml bottle with a bottling date that I cant read cause its smudged out. 

Bottle share during brewday.

Bottle courtesy of rlgk. Pours extremely hazy and milky yellow with a frothy white head that leaves some thick lacing on the glass while dissipating. Smell is heavy fruity and grassy with crackers, grapefruit juice, fleshy mango, fleshy papaya, peaches, pineapple, passion fruit, freshly cut grass, pine needles, liquorice root and lemon zest. Taste is bitter, very tiny sour, fruity and grassy. Mouthfeel is soft, round, tiny dry, very tiny tart and medium bodied. Finish is very tiny sour and bitter with crackers, grapefruit juice, fleshy tropical fruits and peppery grassy hops. Extremely juice and extremely delicious. Insane tropical fruit character and nice supporting peppery grassy hops. Silly good!
Yellow. Tropical, grassy and bready. Balanced bitter and light sweet to dry. Medium bodied.

Sample at The Trillium and Tree House-tasting in Kville, Göteborg. Cloudy golden beer with a nice lasting offwhite head. Hoppy pine and mango aroma, lemon juice, diesel, tangerines, pine apples, orange zest, some peach. Hoppy citrus flavor, peach, pine apples, papaya, great fresh hops, tangerines, lemon zest, some licorice, some caramel. Abso-fuckin-lutely amazing.
Pours murky pale golden with a nice off white head. Aroma is packed with fruits citrus grapefruit hops. Flavor is as aroma lots of tropical fruits citrus pungent bitterness fresh hops. Fantastic.
A: Cloudy white/orange/brown with a white head N: Pine, honeydew, grapefruit, mango T: Grapefruit, mango, lime, liqourice root, pine O: Wow! Amazing flavours! There is so much going on!

UPDATED: APR 4, 2016 Bomber thanks to bigda83! Pours an opaque yellow from the bottle with fluffy off-white head that leaves moderate lace. Aroma of huge grapefruit notes, big amarillo and citra notes. Taste follows, minimal bitterness, but huge hop presence. Again, new England delivers with hops, but looks like garbage water.
750ml bottle pours a murky pale yellow color. Looks like pineapple juice. Pineapple and apricot aroma from the bottle. Pineapple and mango flavors with perfect hop balance.
Thanks to Matt for this one, what double galaxy? THANKS! Great IPA, tons of tropical fruits from the galaxy, base is standard trillium, light, a touch of wheat, light bitterness.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy, turbid, yellow with sudsy white head. Aromas of citrus, tropical, pine, grass, and earthy. Flavor comes out as mango, grapefruit, orange, pine, and earthy. Full bodied, thick oily texture, soft carbonation, bitter to finish.

Bottle shared by Dave M, thanks for the opportunity.
Turbid grapefruit juice with a small head. Big juicy fruity tropical pine aromas with a faint sweet bread deep underneath. Certainly nothing to look at, but tasty as hell.

From a 750ml bottle at the DC tasting on March 25, 2016. Poured a very hazy golden yellow color with a white head. Aroma was lots of citrus orange peel notes, light funky hop, juicy notes. Pretty tasty.

75cl bottle. Small off-white head atop murky apple juice body. Aroma is moderately sweet, grapefruit, some dank, light tangerine. Taste is moderately sweet, grapefruit rind, light grapefruit. Medium body, some acidity.
Actually not as sharp as the regular congress. Lots of citrus and some peel. Hazy yellow pour ok good head. Bitter finish. Bottle thanks to bigsexy410.
From a 22 oz bottle at the Rate Beer tasting March 25, 2016. Pours a murky pale gold with an off white head. Earthy citrus aroma. Flavors of pine and orange. Bitter finish.
Bottle. Cloudy to murky pale yellow color, scant head. Aroma of freshly cut hay, subtle scallions. Taste is lightly bitter and earthy citrus. Tasty.
750ml capped. Super milky golden greenish hue. Tons of bitter/juicy/piney hops on the nose. The taste really is what the nose predicts and all I can do to describe this is to say its a hop horchata.

Thanks Andy Mac, forgot your username I'm drunk. Rare. Great looking beer like grapefruit juice w some foam and lace. Nose of dank celery citrus grapefruit bvc is vaping so maybe that too. Flavors of dank celery citrus dank white sugar. Thin but assertive celery dank tropical fruit. White sugar everywhere. Solid beer.

Bottle (750 ml). Shared by JulienHuxley, thanks! Split 2-ways. Milky glowing golden with a medium white head, good retention, leaving good lacing. Flavors of garlic (loads of), super dank, resinous hops, citrus, juicy oranges, lemon peel, grass and mild spiciness. Very lean maltiness and bitterness level is moderate. Medium body. Moderate to medium carbonation. Super garlicky and dank finish. Another amazing double dry-hopped beer from Trillium. So dank and juicy. Loved it.

Bottle from thepatrickman-thanks! Cloudy brownish yellow. Nose is lots of garlic/onion and not much else for me...not bad, but all the tropical elements from the deScription are missing. Taste follows. Nice round mouthfeel, good balance, just too vegetal for me.

750ml bottle, shared by JulienHuxley. Milky blonde with a thin foamy white head. Flavors are bread, soft cereals, garlic, melon, grapefruit, tropical fruits and resinous hops with dank and floral notes. Light to medium body, soft carbonation, velvety texture.

Bottle thanks to Rainer. Pours a murky yellow gold with medium frothy off white head that lasts. The aroma is strong tropical fruit and spruce. Medium mouth, juicy dank hop, nectarine, light bitterness, very nice.

Bottle, shared. Glowing hazy gold pour with thin lacy white head. Oh, my, god aroma, super rich, potent weed, mega dank, resinous and juicy, fresh citrus, garlic. Taste is lightly bitter, orange, pine, light garlic, it basically drinks itself. Palate is med bodied with light, silky carbonation. Incredibly good.

Poured from a 750ml bottle into a tulip (thanks Jared): Chunky gross golden color, probably the most yeast chunks Ive ever seen come out of an IPA including Heady which is saying something. Aroma is fantastic, lemon peel, other citrus, slightly tropical. Taste is pure fruit juice, lots of lemon and orange. Medium body, almost no hop bitterness, really nice IPA.

Murky muddy golden lazy Brewer pour..... Aroma is out of this world good with orange peel, pineapple juice, and light melon. Taste is good but doesnt quite live up to the aroma. Taste is bitter mineral water yeasty and fruity. Great beer.

Merci à Marc-Olivier pour le partage! Peu de mousse lors du service. De ce liquide trouble émane les arômes caractéristiques qui font la Signature de la Maison. Ceux-ci ne mapparaissent pas bien différents de la Congress Street régulière qui se distingue déjà par sa confiture de fruits. Légère déception en bouche alors que le liquide mapparaît plutôt mince et court. Sans aller à dire aqueux, cette IPA me semble manquer de tonus malgré sa franche amertume. Jaime bien mais je ne la préfère pas à la régulière.

750ml bottle pours a very murky gold with some creamy, white head. Nose is floral, lemons, orange blossoms, light grass, some honey, some yeast. Flavor is sweet with orange blossom honey, honey suckle, malt, yeast, lemon, orange, grass, faint tropical fruits. Finishes creamy, light sweet. A bit different than some of their others.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2016 Bottle from Redstone in Stomham MA.
Pours super cloudy, milky white/yellow with minimal white head. Really strange look to this beer, but I guess this is typical for the NE style IPA.  Its completely opaque. Aroma is faaaantastic. Piney sticky tropical fruit (mango, pineapple) lasting throughout. I would make an air freshener out of this beer. Taste is similar, piney resin, tropical fruit, a little citrus. Velvety smooth with a little lasting bitterness. One of the best IPAs Ive ever had.  Check that...one of the best BEERS Ive ever had.
Pours white grapefruit into a tulip. No head as usual. Mango and tangerine aromas. Soft with resin and mango upfront turning to dry deep resin and grapefruit through the lasting finish.

750ml bottle in a tulip. Pours murky golden with a white head. Aroma of amazing fruity and citrusy hops, some pale malts, and more hops. Flavor the same with a great hoppiness. Average Trillium texture. A very good beer.

Fresh bottle at home. This is an insane beer. On one hand, its so cloudy that its downright ugly, but at the same time its insanely smooth and velvety as you drink it. On one hand its over-the-top in how much hop aroma is packed into it, and then again its so concentrated that it seems to give real hop juice directly into your mouth. This is big, mad, and one of the best celebrations of really juicy hops that Ive ever encountered.

75cl bottle at Zwanze Day 2014, Kernel, London. Many thanks to Leighton for this one. It pours a cloudy yellow-golden color with a small creamy white head. Aroma is rich juicy and fruity with notes of citrus, pine cones, mango, peaches. Taste is medium crispy and dry and lightly fruity resinous and sweet, with notes of tropical fruit salad, apricot and citrus. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, quite nice.

25/VII/15 - 75cl bottle from a trade @ Trillium tasting, home - BB: n/a, bottled: VI/6/15 (2015-989) Thanks to Thomas for muling this trade!
Cloudy pale beige to yellowish beer, creamy off-white head, pretty stable, adhesive, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: amazingly good stuff, holy moly! Very fruity, piny, resinous, pineapples, passion fruits. MF: soft carbon, medium to full body, creamy texture. Taste: fruity start, lots of citrus, piny, bit of grapefruit, little funky, pineapple. Aftertaste: citrus, very fruity, bitter, very nice, pineapple, lovely beer, bit sweet.

Bottle at all killer no filler warm up. Pours a murky colour is somewhere between pineapple and peach on the colour spectrum. Aroma is pineapple, peach, mango and nectarine. Taste is peach, nectarine, pineapple, mandarin with a moderate citric bitterness. Full bodied with a coating mouthfeel.

75cl bottle courtesy of and shared with Tderoeck.
Couleur reste assez trouble, presque boueuse nettement plus que la version de base, léger dorée, col blanc.
Arôme fruité, agrumes, tropical rétro épicé avec une belle note de levure.
Palais est houblonné assez imposant, agrumes, malté avec un caractère pils, fruité et finement houblonné qui arrive sur la fin. Ressent quasi une fine pointe poivrée.

UPDATED: DEC 4, 2015 Thanks to tderoeck, enjoyed at his place with tderoeck, sebletitje, 77ships and omgrich. Extra hoppy version of the regular Congress Street which we tasted next to it. Looks exactly the same: stable, frothy, hops-enhanced, snow white, creamy head, cloudy peach yellow blonde colour. Very aromatic, spruce, lemon zest, flowers, lime, hemp, peach, pineapple, soap, very close to the regular one but more aromatic still and a bit more lush and exotic. Same for the flavour: it has the same clean but lively fruitiness in onset, perhaps a bit more pineapple flavour but difficult to say, same degree of carbonation (fizzy but not too much), same light bready malt profile, but a more complex, more outspoken and more bittering hoppiness, with a bit more earthiness and yeastiness in the finish. This one has a tad more grapefruit hoppiness and more fragrance, but I cannot say this automatically makes it better than the regular Congress Street: to me, both are on a par as being very elegant, refined, fragrant IPAs of world class quality. Hugely enjoyed both - apparently the Trillium hype is well-deserved.

Thanks to tderoeck! 750 ml. bottle split by five. 6 weeks old. Very hazy orange, creamy white head. Nose is creamy yeast, melon, sugar, barn, white pepper, light pineapple, Taste is very creamy milky melon, dry grass, light lemon, pineapple, hay, Very creamy, Very nice, I slightly preferred the regular version but that is just nitpicking really.

Bottled 6/9/15. Bottle to snifter. Pours a quite murky light orange deep yellow color, looks like juice. Off white head. All I can say about the aroma is WOW! Huge citrus, grapefruit, pineapple, tropical fruit character. Flavor is just a tad sharp, hence the drop in points, but still wonderful. Some of that sharpness lingers into the finish. Irregardless, this is a wonderful beer! Thanks JP for sending me this one!

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2017 32oz growler filled 6/11/15, drunk 6/30/15Well, I let er sit in the bottom of the fridge for 2.5 weeks, always hoping the sediment will drop. I think Im just going to give up on doing that and accept that Trilliums beers pour like a milkshake. This one looks like a lemon curd shake, yet the large white head is very well-retained. Go figure.At first whiff, its quite fragrant. Inescapable lemons, light grapefruit pith, orange blossom are all fresh and brighten the nose nicely. As it breathes a bit, and over the course of the first glass or so, I definitely get a distinct note of green onions. Its not awful (surprisingly) and theres no garlic to go with it, thankfully. The nose is very dry, yet you can sense a soft backing of lightly doughy, lightly honeyed malts in the background that never allow the nose to get too astringent/resinous. No alcohol or flaws.The flavor is quite a rollercoaster. Over the half hour or so it took me to drink this, I got the very strong, dry lemon-grapefruit character, which then seemed to transition in to the scallion-like flavor, which in turn gave way to a very distinct watermelon/tangerine flavor. Either my palate adjusted to the scallion, or it disappeared. Whatever the case, the last glass was pure watermelon and citrus bliss. I kept waiting for the beer to get sweeter as it warmed, but it remained wonderfully well-attenuated and yet soft and supple.So here I am, scoring a scallion-flavored IPA a 4+. Also, the amount of citrus character in these things is unbelievable. The watermelon/nectarine/strawberry character really helped break that up, but its still close to a citrus bomb. Yet theres never a bit of syrupiness, astringency or resin, and to be honest, I never care too much what flavors my beers have, as long as the elements (bitter/alcohol/malt/sour/roast) are balanced (not counting some lambics) and the texture is highly drinkable.Mid April 2017 batchWhew...this was pretty unbelievable.  Spicy as all hell with tons of enjoyable, varied juice notes and yet a bit more bitterness than usual, as well.  Soft, dry but creamy almost.  Very sublime and with no resin/alcohol or flaw.  One of the better batches Ive ever had.

Bomber courtesy of and shared with Kermis, big thanks.
Thick creamy white head. Cloudy blond pour. Lovely bitterness. very well done.

Bottle shared. Pours very cloudy orange with an off white head. Aroma of tropical fruits, orange peel, resinous hops, light grapefruit and a citrus touch. Flavour is light to moderate sweet and moderate bitter with a huge resinous juicy hop palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. Beautiful hop bomb!

Bottle, courtesy of kermis. Pours a milky yellow beer with a big white head on top. Aroma is light, citric, pineapple, resin. Flavour is like drinking hop juice, fresh, bitter and incredibly resinous and full. Aftertaste is mild and bitter, very long and nice. Good stuff.

Amazingly balanced! Great aroma. The incredible cloudiness was a mild turn off, but every other aspect was great!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Mango pour, white head. Incredible hop aroma of pine, mango, tangerine, orange, tropical fruit. Flavor is pine resin, citrus, caramel and bready malt, fantastically bitter. Holy shit.

Bottle, shared by Al. Pours murky orange/mango juice color with creamy white head. Lots of lace. Smell is very impressive with tangerine cream, grapefruit, light guava, and pineapple. Flavor is orange lazurus, pine, bitter and slightly ashy hops with a touch of residual sugar left behind. Nice but the aroma was much better for me. Medium to chewy mouthfeel.
Bottle from brewery. Aroma is an explosion of tropical fruit and floral hops. Taste is juicy sweet tropical and citrus fruits, with a perfectly balanced bitterness. Pretty much IPA perfection.

Aroma: Nice Bittering Hops, Mild Rind, Mild Onions

Appearance: Hazy Golden Straw Hue, Passes Some Light, White Head Ring, Some Lacing

Taste: Rind, Bittering Hops, Mild Onions

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Semi Drying, Mildly Bitter
Bottle. Pours gold white head. Nose/taste of citrus, cracker malt, lemon, flaked oats - medium body.
Bottle. Golden hazy pour with white head. Huge hoppy aromas. Grassy, citrus and herbal hop fill the Flavors. Please drink this fresh its nice.

Bottle, dated 3/3. Pours cloudy pale orange with one finger of white head. Aroma is crazy sweet orange and mandarin with ripe cantaloupe and mango undertones, lightly grassy and floral too. Taste is sweet and bitter orange with candied grapefruit, faint mango, moderate bitterness. Creamy texture, low to medium carb. Slight papery finish. Really good.

Pale golden, green hued, fine white foam. This is very much like a Cellarmaker beer. Melon, vinous, candy, light cooas, apricot, berry, cannabis as it warms, bubblegum, diesel. Finishes lightly sweet. Creamy, smooth feel and about the right heft and abv. Excellent.

Pours cloudy orange, big frothy white head. Aroma is pineapple, mango, fresh citrus, grass, rubber & floral pine. Flavor is some piss, floral notes, bitter fruits, piney finish. Dank, juicy yet dry and dandy.

Bottle. Pours cloudy golden amber with a medium off-white head that dissipates fairly quickly leaving good lacing. Aroma is pine, dankness, onion, mango, citrus, wet leaves. Flavor is light sweet and light bitter, hella juicy. Medium light body, creamy mouthfeel. Solid Beer.

750 ml bottle poured into a Spiegelau tulip. Bottled 3/3/2015. Murky orange with almost two fingers of off-white head. Aromas of citrus, a little caramel, floral notes, orange zest, a bit of stone fruit. Tastes of grapefruit and orange citrus, tropical fruit, floral notes. Medium body with a semi-dry finish. Medium carbonation, juicy mouthfeel. Tasty variation on the regular version.

Wow! When you open a beer and the aroma wafts directly to your nostrils like this, you know youre in for a treat. Pineapple, mango, grapefruit, awesomeness! Super hazy bright yellow pour, almost like pineapple juice, with a big fluffy head and lacing. Big time flavor and aroma for only a single IPA. Boom!

750mL bottle dated 030315 from Redstone. Pours cloudy straw gold with a white head. Aroma is tropical fruit, onion, garlic. Flavor is mango, grapefruit. Grapefruit peel bitter in the finish. Theres some left in the bottle and its going in my glass!

Shared by Brian bottled 03/03/2015, nice man thanks for such a fresh sample! Looks like hazy grapefruit juice with very thin head. Aroma is fruit, big tropical notes with light scallion and onions with a very mild grass, just damn lovely! 
The flavor is just as bright and juicy. Mango, papaya with a great danky, onion/ scallion flavors. The garlic /onion/ scallion note reminds me of a few other Artisanal New England brews. The hops are only lightly bitter and is supported by a nice level of grain and pale malts. Love this brew as well as many others from this fine brewer.

Bottle shared at Kernel Brewery at Zwanze Dat 20/09/2014. Huge thanks to Leighton for this. Aroma is a lovely hop bouguet, melon and peach fruits with grassy amsd light citrus notes. Really nice. Hazed yellow / straw coloured pour with a thin white head. Flavour is composed of light caramel and grainy base malts, resinous hops, light mellow citrus, bitter grassy finish. Palate has a super nice dry finish, grainy, fullish body and highish carbonation. Very tasty beer.

20th September 2014Zwanze Day at the Kernel. Keg. Big thanks to Leighton. Very hazy gold beer, small pale cream colour head. Palate is light and airy. Fine carbonation. Lovely light airy malts, Motueka like floralness. Touch of hop spice. Well integrated hop skunk and a little citrus. Light airy finish. Very nice.

Bottle split at Mother Arch during the 2014 Zwanze Celebrations, thanks to our very own Leighton, 20/09/14.
Opaque orange golden with a good sized off white covering.
Nose is peachy, dank hoppage, spice, pine, grapefruit.
Taste comprises bitter orange, pine, spice, tangerine, sour dough bread, mandarin, juicy hop resonance.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Solid IPA.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared during Zwanze 2014 - London. Pours lightly hazy gold with a creamy white head. Lovely nose, big floral hops, grass, pithy citrus. Medium sweet flavor with dry cotrus notes, pale bread, pine, lemon rindc flowers, grapefruit. Medium bodied with fine to average carbonation. Great balance on the finish, gorgeous citrus pith, tangerine, pale malts. Stunning stuff.

Bottle thanks to Leighton. It pours cloudy golden with a small white head. The nose is juicy, passion fruit, juicy tropical fruits, peachy, candy and five alive fruit juice. The taste is crisp, juicy, fruity, peach, apricot, sherbet, with a dry, citrussy finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Crisp, fruity and juicy.
